intro: Garayanthus flexus, commonly known as the flexible garayanthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic environments. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, contributing to its unique appearance.
